meanings.definition: To put out (a fire, light, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The firefighter used water to extinguish the flames.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to extinguish all candles before leaving the room.
meanings.sent3: Trying to extinguish a fire with a feather would be quite comical.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright, it seemed to extinguish all the darkness around her.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain came down hard, working to extinguish the campfire completely.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's signal to line up extinguished the recess period.
meanings.sent2: His apology helped extinguish the argument between the friends.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick to extinguish the show was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The final note of the song seemed to extinguish all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunset marked the end of the day, slowly extinguishing the light.

meanings.sent1: The powerful storm threatened to extinguish the entire village.
meanings.sent2: The dictator aimed to extinguish any opposition to his rule.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to extinguish all evil from the city.
meanings.sent4: The virus spread quickly, threatening to extinguish the population.
meanings.sent5: The floodwaters rose rapidly, threatening to extinguish all signs of civilization.
